meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise or cry.
meanings.sent1: The parrot was squawking loudly in the pet store.
meanings.sent2: The seagulls were squawking by the beach.
meanings.sent3: The squawking parrot made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock squawked like a startled bird in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The squawking of the car brakes was deafening in the quiet street.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh noise or cry.
meanings.sent1: The annoying squawking of the crows woke me up early.
meanings.sent2: The squawking of the geese filled the air at the park.
meanings.sent3: The squawking of the chickens sounded like a mini concert in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The squawking of the old door hinges echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The squawking of the seagulls added to the chaos of the busy pier.
